--- title: "Dataset Project" description: "Analysing a spcific dataset of my choosing" image: images/illustration-of-a-hare-at-a-keyboard-vector-sticker-of-a-white-cute-cartoon-rabbit-hacker-meme-sticker-rodent-animal-hits-the-keyboard-2WD8316.jpg author: - name: Brenda Cruz affiliation: University of California, Davis date: 10-24-2024 format: pdf : grid: margin-width: 350px code-fold: true code-summary: "Show the code" categories: [MyProjects, R, Bioinformatics] draft: false # setting this to `true` will prevent your post from appearing on your listing page until you're ready! title-block-banner: true --- For my project, I decided to explore healthcare insurance data sets because I'm interested in understanding how medical conditions influence healthcare costs. # Healthcare Insurance Data set ::: {.cell execution_count=1} ``` {.python .cell-code} import matplotlib.pyplot as plt import pandas as pd url = 'healthcare_dataset.csv' df = pd.read_csv(url) df.head(5) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=1} ```{=html}
Name Age Gender Blood Type Medical Condition Date of Admission Doctor Hospital Insurance Provider Billing Amount Room Number Admission Type Discharge Date Medication Test Results
0 Bobby JacksOn 30 Male B- Cancer 2024-01-31 Matthew Smith Sons and Miller Blue Cross 18856.281306 328 Urgent 2024-02-02 Paracetamol Normal
1 LesLie TErRy 62 Male A+ Obesity 2019-08-20 Samantha Davies Kim Inc Medicare 33643.327287 265 Emergency 2019-08-26 Ibuprofen Inconclusive
2 DaNnY sMitH 76 Female A- Obesity 2022-09-22 Tiffany Mitchell Cook PLC Aetna 27955.096079 205 Emergency 2022-10-07 Aspirin Normal
3 andrEw waTtS 28 Female O+ Diabetes 2020-11-18 Kevin Wells Hernandez Rogers and Vang, Medicare 37909.782410 450 Elective 2020-12-18 Ibuprofen Abnormal
4 adrIENNE bEll 43 Female AB+ Cancer 2022-09-19 Kathleen Hanna White-White Aetna 14238.317814 458 Urgent 2022-10-09 Penicillin Abnormal
``` ::: ::: ## What condition was billed the most? The pie chart below shows that **diabetes** was one of the most billed conditions at 16.8% of the total billing amount. A total amount billed of 2.385397e+08. ::: {.cell caption-location='margin' execution_count=2} ``` {.python .cell-code} billing_by_condition = df.groupby('Medical Condition')['Billing Amount'].sum().reset_index() billing_by_condition = billing_by_condition.sort_values(by='Billing Amount', ascending=False) plt.pie(billing_by_condition['Billing Amount'], labels=billing_by_condition['Medical Condition'], autopct='%1.1f%%') plt.title('Total Billing Amount per Medical Condition') plt.show() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![Additionally, the person with the highest bill was Karen Kline. She was billed a total 104746.064748 by United Healthcare in the span of](index_files/figure-pdf/fig-margin-cap-output-1.pdf){#fig-margin-cap fig-pos='H'} ::: ::: \\ ::: {.cell execution_count=3} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Name kARen klInE 104746.064748 Name: Billing Amount, dtype: float64 ``` ::: ::: I decided to understand how diabetes was being treated and how it would affect the cost. This shows that the number one insurance provider for people with Diabetes was Medicare with 1730 patients total. Additionally Medicare had the highest amount billed which could be to to the the fact that they had more patients. ::: {.cell execution_count=4} ``` {.python .cell-code} diabetes = df[df['Medical Condition'] == 'Diabetes'] df_unique = diabetes.drop_duplicates(subset='Name', keep='first') insurance = df_unique['Insurance Provider'].value_counts() print(insurance) costly = df.groupby(df_unique['Insurance Provider'])['Billing Amount'].sum().sort_values(ascending=False).head(5) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Insurance Provider Medicare 1730 Blue Cross 1683 Cigna 1679 Aetna 1668 UnitedHealthcare 1624 Name: count, dtype: int64 ``` ::: ::: Lipitor was the drug most likely prescribed to someone with diabetes. A reason for this is that people with diabetes are twice as likely to have [heart disease](https://www.cdc.gov/diabetes/diabetes-complications/diabetes-and-your-heart.html) or a stroke compared to people without diabetes. Medications such as Lipitor are effective at lowering low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol lowering the chances of a stroke. However, penicilin was the the medication that was billed the most. ::: {.cell execution_count=5} ``` {.python .cell-code} medication = diabetes['Medication'].value_counts() print(medication) plt.bar(medication.index, medication.values) plt.xlabel('Medication') plt.ylabel('Frequency') plt.title('Frequency of Medications') plt.show() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Medication Lipitor 1893 Penicillin 1881 Ibuprofen 1861 Aspirin 1858 Paracetamol 1811 Name: count, dtype: int64 ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-pdf/cell-6-output-2.pdf){fig-pos='H'} ::: ::: ::: {.cell execution_count=6} ``` {.python .cell-code} costmed = df.groupby(diabetes['Medication'])['Billing Amount'].sum().sort_values(ascending=False).head(5) newdf = diabetes[['Medication', 'Insurance Provider', 'Billing Amount']] medication_billing = newdf.groupby(['Insurance Provider', 'Medication'])['Billing Amount'].sum().sort_values(ascending=False).head(8).reset_index() print(medication_billing) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Insurance Provider Medication Billing Amount 0 Medicare Aspirin 1.076458e+07 1 Cigna Lipitor 1.039165e+07 2 Aetna Paracetamol 1.014584e+07 3 Aetna Penicillin 9.897654e+06 4 Cigna Penicillin 9.862867e+06 5 Blue Cross Ibuprofen 9.843164e+06 6 Blue Cross Lipitor 9.768164e+06 7 Medicare Paracetamol 9.748423e+06 ``` ::: ::: plot(1:10) And then set the caption location in the code chunk like this: ```yaml #| label: fig-margin-cap #| fig-cap: "This is a caption in the margin." #| caption-location: margin
